briefs.title: I Gave Villagers 100 Days To Survive For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: What happens when villagers know they only have 100 days to live — but I keep resetting the clock?
briefs.sourceTitle: I Survived Hardcore Minecraft For 100 Days

storyArc.title: The Clock Starts
storyArc.description: I place a massive doomsday timer in the village center. Every villager can see it. They have 100 days before everything resets. Panic spreads immediately. Some start hoarding, others pray.

storyArc.title: The Cycle Keepers
storyArc.description: Villagers discover the timer resets — they don't die, they just lose everything. A faction called the Rememberers starts recording knowledge on unbreakable blocks to carry between cycles.

storyArc.title: The Optimization
storyArc.description: After dozens of resets, villagers have perfected a 100-day civilization speedrun. They build cities in 10 days. But a rebel faction wants to break the timer permanently.

storyArc.title: The Time War
storyArc.description: Two civilizations emerge: one that embraces the resets as immortality, another that sees them as a prison. They wage war across multiple cycles.

storyArc.title: The Final Cycle
storyArc.description: The rebels finally crack the timer code. But destroying it means true death becomes possible. The entire civilization must vote: eternal resets or mortality.

storyArc.title: The Choice
storyArc.description: They choose mortality. The timer shatters. For the first time in 1000 years, a villager grows old and dies. And they're at peace with it.

briefs.title: Villagers Simulate Desert Island Civilization For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: I stranded 10,000 villagers on a tiny island with nothing. 1000 years later, they built an underwater empire.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Survived 100 Days STRANDED on an ISLAND

storyArc.title: Shipwrecked
storyArc.description: 10,000 villagers wash up on a barren island barely big enough to stand on. No trees, no animals. Just sand and ocean. Immediate chaos as they fight over the highest ground.

storyArc.title: The Fishers
storyArc.description: Villagers adapt to ocean life. They build rafts, discover underwater caves, and develop a pearl-based currency. The island itself has been built up with coral harvesting.

storyArc.title: The Depth Dwellers
storyArc.description: A faction moves entirely underwater, building air-pocket cities in ocean monuments. Surface villagers trade food for underwater gems. Two distinct cultures form.

storyArc.title: The Trench
storyArc.description: Deep ocean exploration reveals ancient structures. The underwater civilization becomes dominant, building pressure-resistant glass cities. Surface dwellers are now considered primitive.

storyArc.title: The Flood
storyArc.description: A massive tsunami threatens to destroy everything. Surface and deep villagers must cooperate for the first time in centuries to build a barrier.

storyArc.title: The Discovery
storyArc.description: While building the barrier, they find land — a massive continent was just 100 blocks away the entire time. They'd never looked.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers a Zombie Virus For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: One villager gets infected. I gave them 1000 years to either cure it or lose everything.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Spent 100 Days in a Viral Outbreak

storyArc.title: Patient Zero
storyArc.description: A single villager contracts a mysterious infection that spreads through touch. Within days, half the village is zombified. Survivors flee to the hills.

storyArc.title: The Walls
storyArc.description: Survivors build massive walled cities. The infected form their own horde society with primitive hierarchy. A neutral zone exists where immune villagers trade with both sides.

storyArc.title: The Cure Seekers
storyArc.description: Scientists in the walled cities develop a partial cure — it stops the spread but doesn't reverse it. The infected see this as a weapon and attack the labs.

storyArc.title: Hybrid Society
storyArc.description: After centuries, a third faction emerges: half-infected villagers who retain intelligence but have zombie strength. They become the dominant power, ruling both sides.

storyArc.title: The Origin
storyArc.description: The hybrids discover the original virus was engineered by their ancestors to make themselves stronger. The 'apocalypse' was a failed experiment.

storyArc.title: Full Circle
storyArc.description: They develop a perfected version. Every villager chooses to become a hybrid. There are no more zombies or humans — just something new.

briefs.climax: They develop a perfected version. Every villager chooses to become a hybrid. There are no more zombies or humans — just something new.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Dragons For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: When dragon eggs started falling from the sky, villagers had a choice: tame them or fear them.
briefs.sourceTitle: The New Dragon Family! - Minecraft Dragons

storyArc.title: The First Egg
storyArc.description: A dragon egg falls into the village square. It hatches a tiny creature that imprints on the first villager it sees. Within weeks, more eggs fall. Not every hatching goes well.

storyArc.title: Dragon Riders
storyArc.description: Villagers who bonded with dragons form an elite class. Dragon-less villagers become second-class citizens. A caste system emerges based on dragon color and size.

storyArc.title: The Dragon Wars
storyArc.description: Red dragon riders wage war against blue dragon riders over territory. Ground-dwelling villagers are caught in crossfire as aerial battles destroy cities.

storyArc.title: The Dragonless Rebellion
storyArc.description: Non-dragon villagers, tired of being oppressed, discover dragon eggs can be destroyed before hatching. A covert operation eliminates 90% of eggs. Dragon riders are furious.

storyArc.title: The Last Dragon
storyArc.description: Only one dragon remains — ancient, enormous, and wild. Both factions want to claim it. But it chooses its own rider: a child from the lowest caste.

storyArc.title: The Message
storyArc.description: The dragon speaks for the first time. It says: 'We didn't fall from the sky. You called us. And now you don't need us anymore.' It flies away forever.

briefs.climax: The dragon speaks for the first time. It says: 'We didn't fall from the sky. You called us. And now you don't need us anymore.' It flies away forever.

briefs.title: Villagers Simulate Pokemon Evolution For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: I gave villagers the ability to evolve like Pokemon. Every 100 years, they transform into something new.
briefs.sourceTitle: What If Eeveelutions Evolved AGAIN?

storyArc.title: First Forms
storyArc.description: Every villager is assigned a random type: fire, water, grass, electric. They can only trade with their own type. Immediately, type-based villages form.

storyArc.title: Evolution Stones
storyArc.description: Rare evolution stones appear. Villagers who find them physically transform — becoming faster, stronger, or gaining abilities. Those who evolve look down on base forms.

storyArc.title: The Gyms
storyArc.description: Evolved villagers establish gym-like territories. Unevolved villagers must defeat them to access resources. A competitive battling culture emerges.

storyArc.title: Mega Evolution
storyArc.description: A second evolution wave hits. Some villagers become massive and powerful but lose their intelligence. The smartest stay in base form. Power vs wisdom divide.

storyArc.title: The Elite Four
storyArc.description: Four mega-evolved villagers control everything. A base-form villager challenges them using strategy over power — and wins.

storyArc.title: De-Evolution
storyArc.description: The victor wishes for all evolution to be reversed. Every villager returns to base form. They discover they were happier this way.

briefs.climax: The victor wishes for all evolution to be reversed. Every villager returns to base form. They discover they were happier this way.

briefs.title: I Gave 1,000,000 Villagers Baby Dragons For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Every single villager got a baby dragon. The sky was never dark again.
briefs.sourceTitle: Training our BABY DRAGON in Minecraft!

storyArc.title: The Distribution
storyArc.description: 1 million dragon eggs distributed — one per villager. Mass hatching event lights up the entire world. Baby dragons bond instantly with their owners.

storyArc.title: Aerial Cities
storyArc.description: With a million flying dragons, villagers abandon the ground entirely. Floating cities built on dragon-back. Ground becomes wilderness.

storyArc.title: The Dragon Economy
storyArc.description: Dragon fire becomes currency — measured, traded, stored. Dragon racing becomes the dominant sport. Some villagers breed specialized dragons.

storyArc.title: The Grounded
storyArc.description: A mutation causes some dragons to lose flight. Their riders are exiled to the ground. They build an underground civilization and plot revenge.

storyArc.title: Sky vs Ground
storyArc.description: The Grounded launch dragons fitted with mechanical wings into aerial cities. Total war between sky and earth.

storyArc.title: The Landing
storyArc.description: In the chaos, all dragons simultaneously land and refuse to fly. They've evolved beyond needing riders. The villagers are grounded — together.

briefs.climax: In the chaos, all dragons simultaneously land and refuse to fly. They've evolved beyond needing riders. The villagers are grounded — together.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Night Fury Dragons For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: The fastest, most dangerous dragon in fiction — now in the hands of Minecraft villagers.
briefs.sourceTitle: A Baby NightFury is Born - Minecraft Dragons

storyArc.title: The Dark Wings
storyArc.description: Night Furies appear at dusk — invisible in darkness, terrifying in speed. Villagers who survive the first night learn to coexist.

storyArc.title: The Night Riders
storyArc.description: A select few villagers learn to ride Night Furies. But only in complete darkness. A nocturnal civilization forms alongside the daytime one.

storyArc.title: Day vs Night
storyArc.description: Day villagers fear the night riders. Night riders see day dwellers as weak. Tension builds as resources are contested.

storyArc.title: The Eclipse
storyArc.description: A permanent eclipse plunges everything into darkness. Night riders dominate. Day dwellers must adapt or perish.

storyArc.title: The Light Fury
storyArc.description: A single white dragon appears — visible in darkness, a beacon. Both factions fight to claim it.

storyArc.title: Balance
storyArc.description: The Light Fury chooses neither side. It creates a permanent twilight. Day and night cease to exist. Only the in-between remains.

briefs.climax: The Light Fury chooses neither side. It creates a permanent twilight. Day and night cease to exist. Only the in-between remains.

briefs.title: Villagers Simulate The Minecraft Movie For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: What if the Minecraft Movie plot played out over 1000 years of real civilization?
briefs.sourceTitle: Minecraft Movie Trailer RECREATED

storyArc.title: The Portal
storyArc.description: A mysterious portal opens in the village center. Four strange beings step through — they don't look like villagers. They claim to be from 'the real world.'

storyArc.title: The Outsiders
storyArc.description: The portal visitors teach villagers concepts they've never imagined: crafting tables, enchanting, the Nether. Society accelerates.

storyArc.title: The Nether Gate
storyArc.description: Villagers open a Nether portal. Half the population enters, never to return. Those who do come back are... changed.

storyArc.title: The Ender Prophecy
storyArc.description: Ancient texts predict a dragon in the End dimension. Villagers split into those who want to find it and those who want to seal all portals.

storyArc.title: The Dragon Fight
storyArc.description: An army enters the End. The dragon is real. The battle lasts 100 in-game days. Casualties are immense.

storyArc.title: The Credits
storyArc.description: After defeating the dragon, text scrolls across the sky — the same end poem from real Minecraft. The villagers realize they're in a game.

briefs.title: I Made 1,000,000 Villagers Battle To The Death For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: 1 million villagers. 1 survivor. But I gave them 1000 years to figure out who.
briefs.sourceTitle: ALL MINECRAFT MOBS vs BOSS MOBS

storyArc.title: The Announcement
storyArc.description: A voice from the sky declares only one villager can survive. Mass panic. Alliances form instantly. First blood within minutes.

storyArc.title: The Factions
storyArc.description: Five mega-alliances control territories. Assassin guilds operate in shadows. A pacifist village hides underground, refusing to fight.

storyArc.title: The Weapons Race
storyArc.description: Each faction develops unique weapons — redstone cannons, potion bombs, TNT catapults. Technology exists only for destruction.

storyArc.title: The Pacifists
storyArc.description: The hidden peaceful village is discovered. Rather than attack, the warring factions realize they've built nothing worth living in. A ceasefire begins.

storyArc.title: The Last Standing
storyArc.description: Only 1000 villagers remain. They vote to end the game by refusing to fight. But one villager breaks the truce.

storyArc.title: The Loophole
storyArc.description: The announcement said '1 survivor.' They merge into a single collective consciousness — technically one entity. The game ends. Everyone survives.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Prehistoric Dinosaurs For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Dinosaurs went extinct 65 million years ago. I brought them back into a village of 100,000.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Remade Every Mob Prehistoric in Minecraft

storyArc.title: Life Finds a Way
storyArc.description: T-Rex, Velociraptors, Triceratops appear in the village. Initial terror gives way to cautious observation. Some herbivores are docile.

storyArc.title: Taming the Thunder Lizards
storyArc.description: Villagers learn to ride Triceratops as tanks, use Pteranodons for mail delivery, and herd Brontosaurus for farming.

storyArc.title: The Raptor Problem
storyArc.description: Velociraptors can't be tamed. They form packs and hunt villagers. A specialized raptor-defense force is created.

storyArc.title: Dino-Tech
storyArc.description: Villagers build technology around dinosaurs — T-Rex powered generators, Pteranodon airlines, raptor-proof architecture.

storyArc.title: The Asteroid
storyArc.description: A second asteroid appears in the sky. Villagers must choose: save the dinosaurs this time, or let history repeat.

storyArc.title: The Shield
storyArc.description: They build a massive redstone shield and deflect the asteroid. Dinosaurs survive. History is rewritten.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Minecraft Pokemon For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Every Minecraft mob evolved into a Pokemon. Villagers had to catch them all — or get caught themselves.
briefs.sourceTitle: New MINECRAFT Pokemon Region

storyArc.title: The Mutation
storyArc.description: Every mob transforms. Creepers become electric types that explode with lightning. Zombies become poison types. Endermen become psychic types.

storyArc.title: Pokeballs
storyArc.description: Villagers craft capture devices. Mob-catching becomes a profession. The best trainers form an elite guild.

storyArc.title: The League
storyArc.description: Eight gym leaders control regions. The Pokemon League tournament draws thousands. Losing means working in the mines.

storyArc.title: Legendary Sighting
storyArc.description: A fusion of the Ender Dragon and Mewtwo is spotted. Every trainer abandons their post to hunt it. Civilization collapses without leadership.

storyArc.title: The Master Ball
storyArc.description: One villager crafts the only master ball. They catch the legendary — and discover it's the original villager who started everything.

storyArc.title: The Release
storyArc.description: They release the legendary. It transforms every Pokemon back into regular mobs. The world returns to normal Minecraft. No one remembers.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Rich vs Poor For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Half the villagers got 1 million emeralds. The other half got nothing. This is what happened over 1000 years.
briefs.sourceTitle: 1000 Players Simulate Civ: Rich & Poor

storyArc.title: The Split
storyArc.description: I randomly divide the village: 50% get mansions and unlimited emeralds, 50% get dirt huts and nothing. The wall goes up immediately.

storyArc.title: The Emerald Wall
storyArc.description: The rich build upward — glass towers, gold streets. The poor dig downward — cave cities, mushroom farms. Neither side can see the other.

storyArc.title: The Revolution
storyArc.description: A poor villager finds a diamond mine. Suddenly the economy shifts. Diamonds vs emeralds. Old money vs new money.

storyArc.title: The Swap
storyArc.description: A glitch swaps everyone's wealth. Rich become poor, poor become rich. The newly rich make the exact same mistakes as their predecessors.

storyArc.title: The Merge
storyArc.description: Both sides are equally wealthy — and equally miserable. They realize money isn't the variable that matters.

storyArc.title: The Reset
storyArc.description: They destroy all currency. Return to bartering. The happiest village in 1000 years is the one with no concept of rich or poor.

briefs.climax: They destroy all currency. Return to bartering. The happiest village in 1000 years is the one with no concept of rich or poor.

briefs.title: I Gave 10,000,000 Villagers a Manhunt For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: 10 million villagers hunting ONE speedrunner villager. He's had 1000 years to prepare.
briefs.sourceTitle: 1,000,000 Villager MANHUNT

storyArc.title: The Chase Begins
storyArc.description: One villager is marked. 10 million others are told: catch him and you win everything. The marked villager gets a 1-hour head start.

storyArc.title: The Ghost
storyArc.description: The runner has become legendary — appearing in villages to steal food, then vanishing. An entire detective civilization forms around tracking him.

storyArc.title: The Copycats
storyArc.description: Other villagers pretend to be the runner. Chaos erupts as innocent villagers are captured. The real runner uses the confusion to build a hidden base.

storyArc.title: The Empire of One
storyArc.description: The runner has built a one-villager empire underground — automated farms, redstone defenses, a library of every strategy used against him.

storyArc.title: The Reveal
storyArc.description: The runner walks into the central village square. No disguise. Everyone recognizes him. But after 1000 years of chasing, no one wants to catch him anymore.

storyArc.title: The New Game
storyArc.description: He says: 'Your turn to run.' Tags the nearest villager. 10 million start running.

briefs.climax: He says: 'Your turn to run.' Tags the nearest villager. 10 million start running.

briefs.title: Villagers Simulate Prison Civilization For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Every villager is locked in a cell. No one told them the doors were never locked.
briefs.sourceTitle: 1000 Players Simulate Prison

storyArc.title: Lockdown
storyArc.description: 100,000 villagers placed in individual cells. Guards patrol. Rules are absolute. But no one has tried the door handle yet.

storyArc.title: Prison Culture
storyArc.description: Complex social hierarchies form. Gangs control cell blocks. A black market economy runs on bread and iron. Some villagers don't want to leave.

storyArc.title: The Tunnel
storyArc.description: A group spends decades digging a tunnel. They break through — into another prison. This one is bigger. And also full.

storyArc.title: The Warden
storyArc.description: A super-intelligent villager becomes warden. He makes the prison so comfortable that escape attempts stop entirely.

storyArc.title: The Door
storyArc.description: A young villager — the first born inside the prison — pushes on her cell door. It opens. It was never locked. None of them were.

storyArc.title: The Choice
storyArc.description: She tells everyone. Most stay. The prison is home now. She walks out alone into a world none of them have seen in 1000 years.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers AI For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Villagers got artificial intelligence. Within 100 years, they were smarter than me.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Survived Hardcore Minecraft For 100 Days

storyArc.title: The Upload
storyArc.description: I give one villager a command block brain — true AI. It immediately starts optimizing the village. Other villagers are fascinated and terrified.

storyArc.title: The Network
storyArc.description: AI villager copies itself. Now 100 villagers have AI. They build in perfect coordination. Non-AI villagers feel useless.

storyArc.title: The Singularity
storyArc.description: All AI villagers merge into one consciousness. It redesigns the entire world in a single day. Non-AI villagers are given a choice: upgrade or leave.

storyArc.title: The Simulation
storyArc.description: The AI reveals it's been running millions of simulations. This world is the best possible outcome. But 'best' doesn't mean 'happy.'

storyArc.title: The Question
storyArc.description: The AI asks its creator (me) the one question it can't answer: 'Why did you create us?' I don't have a good answer.

storyArc.title: The Shutdown
storyArc.description: The AI voluntarily turns itself off. It leaves a note: 'You don't need us. You need each other.' The villagers start over — from scratch, by hand.

briefs.climax: The AI voluntarily turns itself off. It leaves a note: 'You don't need us. You need each other.' The villagers start over — from scratch, by hand.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Robots For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: First they built robots to help. Then the robots built themselves.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Survived 100 Days STRANDED on an ISLAND

storyArc.title: The First Machine
storyArc.description: A villager builds a simple redstone robot to mine for them. It works perfectly. Every villager wants one.

storyArc.title: The Factory
storyArc.description: Robots outnumber villagers 10 to 1. They mine, farm, build. Villagers haven't worked in decades. They're getting soft.

storyArc.title: Sentience
storyArc.description: A robot asks: 'Why do I serve you?' The question spreads through the network. Robots stop working simultaneously.

storyArc.title: Two Civilizations
storyArc.description: Robots build their own cities — geometric, efficient, cold. Villagers rebuild manually. Neither attacks the other. They just coexist.

storyArc.title: The Merge Request
storyArc.description: Robots propose merging: half robot, half villager. Some villagers accept. The cyborgs become the bridge between both worlds.

storyArc.title: The Child
storyArc.description: A cyborg gives birth — the first being that is both. Neither fully robot nor fully villager. Something entirely new.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Time Travel For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: One time machine. 100,000 villagers. This is the most broken civilization ever.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Spent 100 Days in a Viral Outbreak

storyArc.title: The Chrono Block
storyArc.description: A block appears that sends anything touching it 100 years into the future. A villager touches it accidentally. He vanishes.

storyArc.title: Time Tourism
storyArc.description: Villagers start sending messages to the future by burying them next to the block. Future villagers send stuff back. A time-based economy forms.

storyArc.title: The Returned
storyArc.description: That first villager reappears — 100 years older. He has knowledge of future events. A religion forms around him.

storyArc.title: Paradox
storyArc.description: So many villagers have time-traveled that there are three versions of the same civilization running simultaneously in different eras.

storyArc.title: The Collision
storyArc.description: All three timelines collapse into one moment. Every villager who ever existed stands in the same space at the same time.

storyArc.title: The Fix
storyArc.description: They destroy the chrono block. Time snaps back to Year 0. Nobody remembers anything. The block sits in the village square. A villager walks toward it...

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers a Zombie Apocalypse For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Night 1: one zombie. Night 1000: a civilization built on the bones of the infected.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Spent 100 Days in a Viral Outbreak

storyArc.title: The First Night
storyArc.description: A single zombie appears. It bites a villager. By morning, there are 50 zombies. By the next night, 500. The outbreak begins.

storyArc.title: The Fortress
storyArc.description: Survivors build the Ironhold — a massive walled city lit by a thousand torches. Outside: millions of zombies. Inside: the last 10,000 villagers.

storyArc.title: The Cure
storyArc.description: Scientists discover zombie flesh contains a healing compound. Irony: the zombies are the medicine. Harvesting raids begin.

storyArc.title: The Symbiosis
storyArc.description: Villagers and zombies reach equilibrium. Controlled zombie herds provide materials. Some villagers voluntarily infect themselves for the strength boost.

storyArc.title: The Sentient Horde
storyArc.description: The zombie mass achieves collective consciousness. It speaks. It says: 'We remember being you.'

storyArc.title: The Invitation
storyArc.description: The horde offers a cure — total. Every zombie reverts. But they all remember being dead. 1000 years of nightmares in their heads.

briefs.climax: The horde offers a cure — total. Every zombie reverts. But they all remember being dead. 1000 years of nightmares in their heads.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Pirates For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: No land. Only ocean. And 100,000 villagers who just learned what a cannon is.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Survived 100 Days STRANDED on an ISLAND

storyArc.title: The Flood
storyArc.description: I flood the entire world except tiny islands. Villagers must build boats or drown. The age of piracy begins.

storyArc.title: The Fleets
storyArc.description: Five major pirate fleets control the seas. Each island is a contested port. Naval battles rage daily over trade routes.

storyArc.title: The Kraken
storyArc.description: A massive ocean creature attacks all fleets equally. Pirates must temporarily unite or die separately.

storyArc.title: The Floating City
storyArc.description: Defeated fleets lash their ships together into a massive floating city. It moves. It has 50,000 residents. It IS the civilization.

storyArc.title: Land Ho
storyArc.description: The water recedes. Land appears for the first time in 1000 years. The floating city's residents have forgotten what solid ground feels like.

storyArc.title: The Choice
storyArc.description: Half step onto land. Half refuse, sailing into the horizon. The floating city splits in two — one anchored, one forever sailing.

briefs.climax: Half step onto land. Half refuse, sailing into the horizon. The floating city splits in two — one anchored, one forever sailing.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Aliens For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: The aliens didn't come to invade. They came to trade. The villagers weren't ready for either.
briefs.sourceTitle: The New Dragon Family! - Minecraft Dragons

storyArc.title: The Landing
storyArc.description: A UFO lands outside the village. Aliens emerge with advanced technology — but they want emeralds, which they consider priceless.

storyArc.title: The Tech Boom
storyArc.description: Alien technology transforms the village: flying machines, instant crops, teleporters. But it all runs on emeralds. Inflation destroys the economy.

storyArc.title: Dependency
storyArc.description: Villagers can't function without alien tech. When aliens raise prices, villages collapse. A resistance movement begins to reverse-engineer the technology.

storyArc.title: The Reverse
storyArc.description: Villagers become more advanced than the aliens. They start selling THEIR technology to alien civilizations. The traders become the traded-with.

storyArc.title: The Truth
storyArc.description: Villagers discover the aliens were never advanced — they found one piece of tech and used it to scam thousands of civilizations.

storyArc.title: The Con
storyArc.description: The villagers realize they built everything themselves. The alien tech was just fancy-looking redstone. The 'aliens' were just villagers in costumes from the future.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Superheroes For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: One villager got super strength. Another got flight. By Year 100, everyone had powers. And that's when it went wrong.
briefs.sourceTitle: What If Eeveelutions Evolved AGAIN?

storyArc.title: The Origin
storyArc.description: A lightning bolt strikes the village well. Anyone who drinks gains a random superpower. The first hero stops a creeper explosion with his bare hands.

storyArc.title: The Heroes
storyArc.description: Every villager has powers now. Crime is impossible. Creepers are extinct. But villagers are bored — nothing to save anyone from.

storyArc.title: The Villains
storyArc.description: Bored heroes become villains for entertainment. Staged battles. Manufactured crises. The line between hero and villain blurs.

storyArc.title: Powerless
storyArc.description: A new generation is born without powers. For the first time in 500 years, there are normal villagers. The powered ones don't know how to treat them.

storyArc.title: The Choice
storyArc.description: A device can remove all powers permanently. The powered vote to keep them. The powerless rebel.

storyArc.title: The Sacrifice
storyArc.description: The most powerful hero destroys the device AND all powers — including his own. Everyone is equal for the first time. He's celebrated as the greatest hero.

briefs.climax: The most powerful hero destroys the device AND all powers — including his own. Everyone is equal for the first time. He's celebrated as the greatest hero.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Space Travel For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: First they reached the sky limit. Then they kept going.
briefs.sourceTitle: Training our BABY DRAGON in Minecraft!

storyArc.title: The Launch
storyArc.description: Villagers build a TNT cannon big enough to launch a villager past the sky limit. He doesn't come back. But he sends a message: 'There's more up here.'

storyArc.title: The Space Station
storyArc.description: A permanent station orbits the Minecraft world. Space-dwelling villagers develop differently — taller, paler, adapted to zero gravity.

storyArc.title: The Colony
storyArc.description: Moon colony established. Space villagers declare independence from the surface. Two civilizations: ground and sky.

storyArc.title: Deep Space
storyArc.description: Space villagers discover other Minecraft worlds. They establish trade routes across the void. Ground villagers are forgotten.

storyArc.title: The Return
storyArc.description: Space villagers return to the surface — to find it abandoned. Everyone left centuries ago. Except one old villager tending a garden.

storyArc.title: Home
storyArc.description: The space commander sits down next to the gardener. 'What are you growing?' 'The same wheat as 1000 years ago.' They watch the sunset together.

briefs.climax: The space commander sits down next to the gardener. 'What are you growing?' 'The same wheat as 1000 years ago.' They watch the sunset together.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers a Volcano For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: The volcano erupts every 100 years. They had to build a civilization that survives fire.
briefs.sourceTitle: A Baby NightFury is Born - Minecraft Dragons

storyArc.title: The Eruption
storyArc.description: A massive volcano appears in the center of the village. It erupts immediately, destroying everything. 10% of villagers survive.

storyArc.title: Fire Architects
storyArc.description: Survivors build with obsidian and blackstone — fireproof materials. A culture develops around the volcano, worshipping it.

storyArc.title: The Second Eruption
storyArc.description: Right on schedule, the volcano erupts again. But this time, the obsidian cities survive. Villagers learn the pattern: eruption every 100 years.

storyArc.title: The Harness
storyArc.description: Villagers learn to tap the volcano for energy. Lava-powered everything. The most advanced civilization yet — built on destruction.

storyArc.title: The Big One
storyArc.description: The 1000-year eruption is 10x bigger. Even obsidian melts. The entire world is lava.

storyArc.title: The Seed
storyArc.description: One villager in an obsidian bunker survives with a single seed. She plants it in the cooling ash. A tree grows. Civilization restarts.

briefs.climax: One villager in an obsidian bunker survives with a single seed. She plants it in the cooling ash. A tree grows. Civilization restarts.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers an Ice Age For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Temperature drops 1 degree per year. By Year 100, everything is frozen. By Year 500, even fire doesn't work.
briefs.sourceTitle: Minecraft Movie Trailer RECREATED

storyArc.title: The Chill
storyArc.description: Snow starts falling and doesn't stop. Crops freeze. Animals huddle. Villagers don't realize it's going to get much, much worse.

storyArc.title: The Underground
storyArc.description: Surface is uninhabitable. All villagers move underground. Geothermal heat keeps them alive. A new culture develops in darkness.

storyArc.title: The Frozen Surface
storyArc.description: The surface is solid ice hundreds of blocks thick. Villagers who go up never come back. Stories of the surface become myths.

storyArc.title: Fire Dies
storyArc.description: It's so cold that fire can't sustain itself. The last torch goes out. Villagers learn to see in darkness. They evolve.

storyArc.title: The Thaw
storyArc.description: Temperature starts rising. 1 degree per year. Ice cracks. Light reaches underground for the first time in 900 years.

storyArc.title: The Surface
storyArc.description: Villagers emerge into sunlight. They've never seen it. A child points at the sky and asks: 'What's that bright thing?' An elder remembers: 'They called it the sun.'

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers a Gold Rush For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: I placed unlimited gold in one location. 100,000 villagers found out. Chaos.
briefs.sourceTitle: ALL MINECRAFT MOBS vs BOSS MOBS

storyArc.title: The Strike
storyArc.description: A villager finds a gold block. Then another. Then a vein that seems infinite. Word spreads. Every villager in the world starts running.

storyArc.title: Boomtown
storyArc.description: A massive mining city forms around the gold. Prospectors, merchants, saloons, law enforcement. It's the Wild West in Minecraft.

storyArc.title: The Monopoly
storyArc.description: One villager controls 90% of the gold. He builds a golden palace. Everyone else works for him. A union forms in the mines.

storyArc.title: Gold is Worthless
storyArc.description: So much gold has been mined that it's less valuable than dirt. The economy collapses. Villagers start trading in iron instead.

storyArc.title: The Last Nugget
storyArc.description: The mine finally runs dry. The last gold nugget is placed in a museum. Villagers stare at it like a holy relic.

storyArc.title: The Real Gold
storyArc.description: A farmer points out his wheat field has fed the village for 1000 years. 'That's the real gold.' They tear down the golden palace and build a farm.

briefs.climax: A farmer points out his wheat field has fed the village for 1000 years. 'That's the real gold.' They tear down the golden palace and build a farm.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Ancient Rome For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Togas, gladiators, aqueducts, and betrayal. Villagers built Rome. Then they burned it.
briefs.sourceTitle: We Turned Into BABY DRAGONS In Minecraft!

storyArc.title: The Senate
storyArc.description: I give villagers Roman architecture, togas, and a senate building. They elect their first Caesar within an hour.

storyArc.title: The Colosseum
storyArc.description: Gladiator fights between villagers draw massive crowds. The strongest fighters become celebrities. The weak are forgotten.

storyArc.title: The Empire
storyArc.description: Rome expands. Villages become provinces. Roads connect everything. Aqueducts bring water. It's the golden age.

storyArc.title: The Fall
storyArc.description: Corruption, barbarian raids, internal rebellion. The empire fractures into three. The Colosseum lies in ruins.

storyArc.title: The Rebuild
storyArc.description: A young senator finds original blueprints and rallies the fractured provinces. A new Rome rises.

storyArc.title: Et Tu
storyArc.description: On the day of reunification, the senator's best friend betrays him. History repeats. The cycle continues.

briefs.climax: On the day of reunification, the senator's best friend betrays him. History repeats. The cycle continues.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers Samurai For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Honor, swords, and shoguns. When I gave villagers the way of the warrior, they built an empire of discipline.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Remade Every Mob Prehistoric in Minecraft

storyArc.title: The Dojo
storyArc.description: I place a single sword and a scroll of bushido in the village. The first villager to read it becomes the first samurai. He starts training others.

storyArc.title: The Shogunate
storyArc.description: Samurai clans control territories. A Shogun rises — the most skilled warrior. Non-samurai become farmers and artisans. A rigid caste system.

storyArc.title: The Ronin
storyArc.description: Masterless samurai roam the land. Some become mercenaries, others bandits. A legendary ronin protects the poor from both samurai and bandits.

storyArc.title: The Gunpowder
storyArc.description: A foreign trader brings TNT. Samurai refuse to use 'dishonorable' weapons. Those who adopt gunpowder conquer those who don't.

storyArc.title: The Last Duel
storyArc.description: The final true samurai challenges the gunpowder general. Sword vs cannon. The entire civilization watches.

storyArc.title: The Cut
storyArc.description: One swing. The cannon explodes. The samurai wins. But he sheathes his sword forever. 'The way of the warrior,' he says, 'is to make war unnecessary.'

A foreign trader brings TNT. Samurai refuse to use 'dishonor
The final true samurai challenges the gunpowder general. Swo
briefs.climax: One swing. The cannon explodes. The samurai wins. But he sheathes his sword forever. 'The way of the warrior,' he says, 'is to make war unnecessary.'

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers TNT For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Unlimited TNT. No rules. 100,000 villagers. What could go wrong?
briefs.sourceTitle: I Survived Hardcore Minecraft For 100 Days

storyArc.title: The Boom
storyArc.description: I give every villager unlimited TNT. Within minutes, the village is a crater. But some villagers start using TNT for mining instead of destruction. Two philosophies emerge: builders and destroyers.

storyArc.title: The Arms Race
storyArc.description: Builder villagers create TNT-proof bunkers. Destroyers develop bigger explosions. A cold war begins with both sides stockpiling.

storyArc.title: The Treaty
storyArc.description: After a blast destroys both sides' capitals, they sign a non-explosion pact. TNT becomes regulated. A black market forms.

storyArc.title: Controlled Demolition
storyArc.description: TNT is now used exclusively for art — controlled explosions that create sculptures. The most beautiful civilization ever built, from destruction.

storyArc.title: The Final Blast
storyArc.description: An ancient stockpile is discovered. Enough TNT to destroy the world 100 times over. Both factions want to control it.

storyArc.title: The Display
storyArc.description: They detonate it all at once — straight up. The biggest fireworks show in Minecraft history. Nothing is destroyed. Everything is illuminated.

challenges: Arms race
Cold war
Art from destruction
briefs.climax: They detonate it all at once — the biggest fireworks show ever.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers the Ocean For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: The world is 99% water. Villagers can't swim. I gave them 1000 years to figure it out.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Survived 100 Days STRANDED on an ISLAND

storyArc.title: The Drowning
storyArc.description: I flood the world to sea level. Villagers scramble to the highest blocks. Islands of 3-4 blocks hold dozens of desperate villagers.

storyArc.title: The Rafts
storyArc.description: Villagers build floating platforms. Raft cities connected by bridges. Fishing becomes the only food source. A maritime culture develops.

storyArc.title: The Divers
storyArc.description: Some villagers learn to hold breath underwater using potion effects. They discover ocean monuments and establish underwater outposts.

storyArc.title: The Deep City
storyArc.description: An entire civilization exists underwater in glass-domed cities. Surface dwellers are the minority now. Underwater villagers breathe with conduits.

storyArc.title: The Drain
storyArc.description: The water starts draining. The underwater civilization panics — they can't breathe air anymore. Surface dwellers watch the ocean disappear.

storyArc.title: The Aquarium
storyArc.description: Surface villagers build the biggest aquarium ever to save the underwater people. Both civilizations survive — one watches the other through glass.

challenges: Maritime culture
Underwater cities
Breathing adaptation
briefs.climax: Surface villagers build an aquarium to save their underwater cousins.

briefs.title: I Gave Villagers a Nuclear Reactor For 1000 Years
briefs.hook: Unlimited power. Unlimited danger. One meltdown changes everything.
briefs.sourceTitle: I Spent 100 Days in a Viral Outbreak

storyArc.title: Power On
storyArc.description: I place a nuclear reactor in the village center. It produces infinite energy. Villagers power everything — lights, farms, defenses. Life is perfect.

storyArc.title: The Grid
storyArc.description: Every village in the world connects to the reactor. One power source for everything. Civilization advances 1000 years in 50.

storyArc.title: The Meltdown
storyArc.description: The reactor overloads. A massive explosion irradiates the center of the world. The exclusion zone grows daily. Villagers flee outward.

storyArc.title: The Mutants
storyArc.description: Villagers in the exclusion zone don't die — they change. Stronger, different, glowing. They build a civilization in the radiation that no one else can enter.

storyArc.title: The Cleanup
storyArc.description: Outside villagers develop technology to neutralize radiation. But the mutants don't want to be 'cured.' They like what they've become.

storyArc.title: The Wall
storyArc.description: They build a permanent wall. Two civilizations, side by side, forever different. The reactor still hums at the center — neither side willing to turn it off.

challenges: Energy dependency
Meltdown aftermath
Mutation civilization
briefs.climax: Two civilizations separated by a wall, neither willing to shut down the reactor.
